intro: Minuartia capillacea, commonly known as the silky sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has slender, branching stems covered with fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, fluffy appearance. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils, often found in alpine or arctic environments. Minuartia capillacea is adapted to cold climates and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
